### Contract Description

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is seeking analytical support to evaluate alternative harvest management strategies for domestic and international fisheries. The objective of this project is to develop analytical tools, technical documentation, and communication materials to inform decision-makers.

The project will support the Canadian Northern Panel to develop new options for international harvest sharing agreements concerning Canadian-origin Skeena and Nass sockeye salmon harvested in commercial fisheries targeting pink salmon in southern Southeast Alaska.

### Objectives

- Develop analytical tools to explore fisheries benefits and conservation risks associated with different fishing patterns and harvest rules under various run size and productivity scenarios.
- Implement revisions to an existing simulation model to accommodate alternative harvest management strategies.
- Summarize simulation model outputs and communicate results to decision-makers.
- Contribute to the development of a technical report describing the simulation model, including the updated harvest model and initial settings and parameters.

### Requirements

The contractor will:
- Develop an updated harvest model to explore alternatives to the current provisions.
- Perform analytical work, including R programming, required to adapt and run the updated model with scenarios selected by a working group.
- Provide training on model operation to North Coast DFO staff.
